additionalProperties.description:
Rules that limit the documents that the index references to a filter expression. All MongoDB index types accept a **partialFilterExpression** option. **partialFilterExpression** can include following expressions:

- equality (`"parameter" : "value"` or using the `$eq` operator)
- `"$exists": true`
, maximum: `$gt`, `$gte`, `$lt`, `$lte` comparisons
- `$type`
- `$and` (top-level only)
 This option applies to all index types.

PartialFilter.description:
Rules that limit the documents that the index references to a filter expression. All MongoDB index types accept a **partialFilterExpression** option. **partialFilterExpression** can include following expressions:

- equality (`"parameter" : "value"` or using the `$eq` operator)
- `"$exists": true`
, maximum: `$gt`, `$gte`, `$lt`, `$lte` comparisons
- `$type`
- `$and` (top-level only)
 This option applies to all index types.

PartitionFieldView.description: Metadata to partition this online archive.

fieldName.description: Human-readable label that identifies the parameter that MongoDB Cloud uses to partition data. To specify a nested parameter, use the dot notation.

fieldType.description: Data type of the parameter that that MongoDB Cloud uses to partition data. Partition parameters of type [UUID](http://bsonspec.org/spec.html) must be of binary subtype 4. MongoDB Cloud skips partition parameters of type UUID with subtype 3.

order.description: Sequence in which MongoDB Cloud slices the collection data to create partitions. The resource expresses this sequence starting with zero. The value of the **criteria.dateField** parameter defaults as the first item in the partition sequence.

PartitionFieldView.title: Online Archive Partition

PemFileInfo.description: PEM file information for the identity provider's certificates.

avgObjSize.description: The average size of an object in the collection of this index.

id.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies this index.

impact.description: List that contains unique 24-hexadecimal character string that identifies the query shapes in this response that the Performance Advisor suggests.

items.description: One unique 24-hexadecimal character string that identifies one query shape.

index.description: List that contains documents that specify a key in the index and its sort order.

additionalProperties.description: One index key paired with its sort order. A value of `1` indicates an ascending sort order. A value of `-1` indicates a descending sort order. Keys in indexes with multiple keys appear in the same order that they appear in the index.

items.description: One index key paired with its sort order. A value of `1` indicates an ascending sort order. A value of `-1` indicates a descending sort order. Keys in indexes with multiple keys appear in the same order that they appear in the index.

namespace.description: Human-readable label that identifies the namespace on the specified host. The resource expresses this parameter value as `<database>.<collection>`.

weight.description: Estimated performance improvement that the suggested index provides. This value corresponds to **Impact** in the Performance Advisor user interface.

PerformanceAdvisorOpStats.description: Details that this resource returned about the specified query.

ms.description: Length of time expressed during which the query finds suggested indexes among the managed namespaces in the cluster. This parameter expresses its value in milliseconds. This parameter relates to the **duration** query parameter.

nReturned.description: Number of results that the query returns.

nScanned.description: Number of documents that the query read.

ts.description: Date and time from which the query retrieves the suggested indexes. This parameter expresses its value in the number of seconds that have elapsed since the [UNIX epoch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time). This parameter relates to the **since** query parameter.

predicates.description: List that contains the search criteria that the query uses. To use the values in key-value pairs in these predicates requires **Project Data Access Read Only** permissions or greater. Otherwise, MongoDB Cloud redacts these values.

items.description: List that contains the search criteria that the query uses. To use the values in key-value pairs in these predicates requires **Project Data Access Read Only** permissions or greater. Otherwise, MongoDB Cloud redacts these values.

shapes.description: List of query predicates, sorts, and projections that the Performance Advisor suggests.

suggestedIndexes.description: List that contains the documents with information about the indexes that the Performance Advisor suggests.

avgMs.description: Average duration in milliseconds for the queries examined that match this shape.

count.description: Number of queries examined that match this shape.

id.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies this shape. This string exists only for the duration of this API request.

inefficiencyScore.description: Average number of documents read for every document that the query returns.

namespace.description: Human-readable label that identifies the namespace on the specified host. The resource expresses this parameter value as `<database>.<collection>`.

operations.description: List that contains specific about individual queries.

PerformanceAdvisorSlowQuery.description: Details of one slow query that the Performance Advisor detected.

line.description: Text of the MongoDB log related to this slow query.

namespace.description: Human-readable label that identifies the namespace on the specified host. The resource expresses this parameter value as `<database>.<collection>`.

slowQueries.description: List of operations that the Performance Advisor detected that took longer to execute than a specified threshold.

clusterName.description: Human-readable name that identifies the cluster.

collectionName.description: Human-readable name that identifies the collection.

databaseName.description: Human-readable name that identifies the database.

groupId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal character string that identifies the project.

policyItemId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal character string that identifies a policy item.

PeriodicCpsSnapshotSource.description: Scheduled Cloud Provider Snapshot as Source for a Data Lake Pipeline.
PeriodicCpsSnapshotSource.title: Periodic Cloud Provider Snapshot Source

PipelineRunStats.description: Runtime statistics for this Data Lake Pipeline run.

bytesExported.description: Total data size in bytes exported for this pipeline run.

numDocs.description: Number of docs ingested for a this pipeline run.

PipelineRunStats.title: Data Lake Pipeline Run Statistics

cloudProvider.description: Cloud service provider that serves the requested endpoint.

deleteRequested.description: Flag that indicates whether MongoDB Cloud received a request to remove the specified private endpoint from the private endpoint service.

endpointGroupName.description: Human-readable label that identifies a set of endpoints.

endpoints.description: List of individual private endpoints that comprise this endpoint group.

errorMessage.description: Error message returned when requesting private connection resource. The resource returns `null` if the request succeeded.

status.description: State of the Google Cloud network endpoint group when MongoDB Cloud received this request.

enabled.description: Flag that indicates whether someone enabled **Connect via Peering Only** mode for the specified project.

cloudProvider.description: Cloud service provider that serves the requested endpoint.

deleteRequested.description: Flag that indicates whether MongoDB Cloud received a request to remove the specified private endpoint from the private endpoint service.

errorMessage.description: Error message returned when requesting private connection resource. The resource returns `null` if the request succeeded.

comment.description: Human-readable string to associate with this private endpoint.

customerEndpointDNSName.description: Human-readable label to identify customer's VPC endpoint DNS name.

endpointId.description: Unique 22-character alphanumeric string that identifies the private endpoint.

externalDocs.description: Atlas Data Lake supports Amazon Web Services private endpoints using the AWS PrivateLink feature.

provider.description: Human-readable label that identifies the cloud service provider. Atlas Data Lake supports Amazon Web Services only.

region.description: Human-readable label to identify the region of customer's VPC endpoint.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies the resource type associated with this private endpoint.

enabled.description:
Flag that indicates whether someone enabled the regionalized private endpoint setting for the specified project.

- Set this value to `true` to enable regionalized private endpoints. This allows you to create more than one private endpoint in a cloud provider region. You need to enable this setting to connect to multi-region and global MongoDB Cloud sharded clusters. Enabling regionalized private endpoints introduces the following limitations:
  - Your applications must use the new connection strings for existing multi-region and global sharded clusters. This might cause downtime.
  - Your MongoDB Cloud project can't contain replica sets nor can you create new replica sets in this project.

  - You can't disable this setting if you have:
    - more than one private endpoint in more than one region
    - more than one private endpoint in one region and one private endpoint in one or more regions.

- Set this value to `false` to disable regionalized private endpoints.

Prometheus.description: Details to integrate one Prometheus account with one MongoDB Cloud project.

enabled.description: Flag that indicates whether someone has activated the Prometheus integration.

listenAddress.description: Combination of IPv4 address and Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) port or the IANA port alone to which Prometheus binds to ingest MongoDB metrics.

scheme.description: Security Scheme to apply to HyperText Transfer Protocol (HTTP) traffic between Prometheus and MongoDB Cloud.

serviceDiscovery.description: Desired method to discover the Prometheus service.

tlsPemPath.description: Root-relative path to the Transport Layer Security (TLS) Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) key and certificate file on the host.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies the service to which you want to integrate with MongoDB Cloud. The value must match the third-party service integration type.

username.description: Human-readable label that identifies your Prometheus incoming webhook.

Prometheus.title: PROMETHEUS

metricName.description: Human-readable label that identifies the metric against which MongoDB Cloud checks the configured **metricThreshold.threshold**.

mode.description: MongoDB Cloud computes the current metric value as an average.

threshold.description: Value of metric that, when exceeded, triggers an alert.

acknowledgedUntil.description: Date and time until which this alert has been acknowledged. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC. The resource returns this parameter if a MongoDB User previously acknowledged this alert. - To acknowledge this alert forever, set the parameter value to 100 years in the future. - To unacknowledge a previously acknowledged alert, set the parameter value to a date in the past.

acknowledgementComment.description: Comment that a MongoDB Cloud user submitted when acknowledging the alert.

acknowledgingUsername.description: MongoDB Cloud username of the person who acknowledged the alert. The response returns this parameter if a MongoDB Cloud user previously acknowledged this alert.

alertConfigId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the alert configuration that sets this alert.

clusterName.description: Human-readable label that identifies the cluster to which this alert applies. This resource returns this parameter for alerts of events impacting backups, replica sets, or sharded clusters.

created.description: Date and time when MongoDB Cloud created this alert. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC.

groupId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the project that owns this alert.

hostnameAndPort.description: Hostname and port of the host to which this alert applies. The resource returns this parameter for alerts of events impacting hosts or replica sets.

id.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies this alert.

lastNotified.description: Date and time that any notifications were last sent for this alert. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC. The resource returns this parameter if MongoDB Cloud has sent notifications for this alert.

links.description: List of one or more Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) that point to API sub-resources, related API resources, or both. RFC 5988 outlines these relationships.

metricName.description: Name of the metric against which Atlas checks the configured `metricThreshold.threshold`. To learn more about the available metrics, see Host Metrics. **NOTE**: If you set eventTypeName to OUTSIDE_SERVERLESS_METRIC_THRESHOLD, you can specify only metrics available for serverless. To learn more, see Serverless Measurements.

orgId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal character string that identifies the organization that owns the project to which this alert applies.

replicaSetName.description: Name of the replica set to which this alert applies. The response returns this parameter for alerts of events impacting backups, hosts, or replica sets.

resolved.description: Date and time that this alert changed to `"status" : "CLOSED"`. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC. The resource returns this parameter once `"status" : "CLOSED"`.

status.description: State of this alert at the time you requested its details.

updated.description: Date and time when someone last updated this alert. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC.

apiKeyId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the [API Key](https://dochub.mongodb.org/core/atlas-create-prog-api-key) that triggered the event. If this resource returns this parameter, it doesn't return the **userId** parameter.

created.description: Date and time when this event occurred. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC.

groupId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the project in which the event occurred. The **eventId** identifies the specific event.

id.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the event.

isGlobalAdmin.description: Flag that indicates whether a MongoDB employee triggered the specified event.

links.description: List of one or more Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) that point to API sub-resources, related API resources, or both. RFC 5988 outlines these relationships.

metricName.description: Human-readable label of the metric associated with the **alertId**. This field may change type of **currentValue** field.

orgId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the organization to which these events apply.

port.description: IANA port on which the MongoDB process listens for requests.

publicKey.description: Public part of the [API Key](https://dochub.mongodb.org/core/atlas-create-prog-api-key) that triggered the event. If this resource returns this parameter, it doesn't return the **username** parameter.

remoteAddress.description: IPv4 or IPv6 address from which the user triggered this event.

replicaSetName.description: Human-readable label of the replica set associated with the event.

shardName.description: Human-readable label of the shard associated with the event.

userId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the console user who triggered the event. If this resource returns this parameter, it doesn't return the **apiKeyId** parameter.

username.description: Email address for the user who triggered this event. If this resource returns this parameter, it doesn't return the **publicApiKey** parameter.

metricName.description: Human-readable label that identifies the metric against which MongoDB Cloud checks the configured **metricThreshold.threshold**.

mode.description: MongoDB Cloud computes the current metric value as an average.

threshold.description: Value of metric that, when exceeded, triggers an alert.

RawMetricUnits.description: Element used to express the quantity. This can be an element of time, storage capacity, and the like.
RawMetricUnits.title: Raw Metric Units

RawMetricValueView.description: Measurement of the **metricName** recorded at the time of the event.

number.description: Amount of the **metricName** recorded at the time of the event. This value triggered the alert.

RawMetricValueView.title: Raw Metric Value

RegionSpec.description: Physical location where MongoDB Cloud provisions cluster nodes.

analyticsNodes.description: Number of analytics nodes in the region. Analytics nodes handle analytic data such as reporting queries from MongoDB Connector for Business Intelligence on MongoDB Cloud. Analytics nodes are read-only, and can never become the primary. Use **replicationSpecs[n].{region}.analyticsNodes** instead.

electableNodes.description: Number of electable nodes to deploy in the specified region. Electable nodes can become the primary and can facilitate local reads. Use **replicationSpecs[n].{region}.electableNodes** instead.

priority.description: Number that indicates the election priority of the region. To identify the Preferred Region of the cluster, set this parameter to `7`. The primary node runs in the **Preferred Region**. To identify a read-only region, set this parameter to `0`.

readOnlyNodes.description: Number of read-only nodes in the region. Read-only nodes can never become the primary member, but can facilitate local reads. Use **replicationSpecs[n].{region}.readOnlyNodes** instead.

RegionSpec.title: Region Configuration

ReplicationSpec.description: Details that explain how MongoDB Cloud replicates data on the specified MongoDB database.

id.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the replication object for a zone in a Multi-Cloud Cluster. If you include existing zones in the request, you must specify this parameter. If you add a new zone to an existing Multi-Cloud Cluster, you may specify this parameter. The request deletes any existing zones in the Multi-Cloud Cluster that you exclude from the request.

numShards.description: Positive integer that specifies the number of shards to deploy in each specified zone. If you set this value to `1` and **clusterType** is `SHARDED`, MongoDB Cloud deploys a single-shard sharded cluster. Don't create a sharded cluster with a single shard for production environments. Single-shard sharded clusters don't provide the same benefits as multi-shard configurations.

regionConfigs.description:
Hardware specifications for nodes set for a given region. Each **regionConfigs** object describes the region's priority in elections and the number and type of MongoDB nodes that MongoDB Cloud deploys to the region. Each **regionConfigs** object must have either an **analyticsSpecs** object, **electableSpecs** object, or **readOnlySpecs** object. Tenant clusters only require **electableSpecs. Dedicated** clusters can specify any of these specifications, but must have at least one **electableSpecs** object within a **replicationSpec**. Every hardware specification must use the same **instanceSize**.

**Example:**

If you set `"replicationSpecs[n].regionConfigs[m].analyticsSpecs.instanceSize" : "M30"`, set `"replicationSpecs[n].regionConfigs[m].electableSpecs.instanceSize" : `"M30"` if you have electable nodes and `"replicationSpecs[n].regionConfigs[m].readOnlySpecs.instanceSize" : `"M30"` if you have read-only nodes.

zoneName.description: Human-readable label that identifies the zone in a Global Cluster. Provide this value only if `"clusterType" : "GEOSHARDED"`.

ReplicationSpec.title: Replication Specifications

role.description:
Human-readable label that identifies the collection of privileges that MongoDB Cloud grants a specific API key, MongoDB Cloud user, or MongoDB Cloud team. These roles include organization- and project-level roles.

Organization Roles

* ORG_OWNER
* ORG_MEMBER
* ORG_GROUP_CREATOR
* ORG_BILLING_ADMIN
* ORG_READ_ONLY

Project Roles

* GROUP_CLUSTER_MANAGER
* GROUP_DATA_ACCESS_ADMIN
* GROUP_DATA_ACCESS_READ_ONLY
* GROUP_DATA_ACCESS_READ_WRITE
* GROUP_OWNER
* GROUP_READ_ONLY
* GROUP_SEARCH_INDEX_EDITOR

items.description: One Uniform Resource Locator that point to the compressed snapshot files for manual download.

expired.description: Flag that indicates whether the restore job expired.

expiresAt.description: Date and time when the restore job expires. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC.

oplogInc.description: Oplog operation number from which you want to restore this snapshot. This number represents the second part of an Oplog timestamp. The resource returns this parameter when `"deliveryType" : "pointInTime"` and **oplogTs** exceeds `0`.

oplogTs.description: Date and time from which you want to restore this snapshot. This parameter expresses this timestamp in the number of seconds that have elapsed since the UNIX epoch. This number represents the first part of an Oplog timestamp. The resource returns this parameter when `"deliveryType" : "pointInTime"` and **oplogTs** exceeds `0`.

pointInTimeUTCSeconds.description: Date and time from which MongoDB Cloud restored this snapshot. This parameter expresses this timestamp in the number of seconds that have elapsed since the UNIX epoch. The resource returns this parameter when `"deliveryType" : "pointInTime"` and **pointInTimeUTCSeconds** exceeds `0`.

targetGroupId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the target project for the specified **targetClusterName**.

timestamp.description: Date and time when MongoDB Cloud took the snapshot associated with **snapshotId**. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC.

createdAt.description: Date and time when MongoDB Cloud took the snapshot. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC.

expiresAt.description: Date and time when MongoDB Cloud deletes the snapshot. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC.

frequencyType.description: Human-readable label that identifies how often this snapshot triggers.

Slack.description: Details to integrate one Slack account with one MongoDB Cloud project.

apiToken.description:
Key that allows MongoDB Cloud to access your Slack account.

**NOTE**: After you create a notification which requires an API or integration key, the key appears partially redacted when you:

* View or edit the alert through the Atlas UI.

* Query the alert for the notification through the Atlas Administration API.

**IMPORTANT**: Slack integrations now use the OAuth2 verification method and must  be initially configured, or updated from a legacy integration, through the Atlas  third-party service integrations page. Legacy tokens will soon no longer be  supported.

channelName.description: Name of the Slack channel to which MongoDB Cloud sends alert notifications.

teamName.description: Human-readable label that identifies your Slack team. Set this parameter when you configure a legacy Slack integration.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies the service to which you want to integrate with MongoDB Cloud. The value must match the third-party service integration type.

Slack.title: SLACK

apiToken.description:
Slack API token or Bot token that MongoDB Cloud needs to send alert notifications via Slack. The resource requires this parameter when `"notifications.[n].typeName" : "SLACK"`. If the token later becomes invalid, MongoDB Cloud sends an email to the project owners. If the token remains invalid, MongoDB Cloud removes the token. 

**NOTE**: After you create a notification which requires an API or integration key, the key appears partially redacted when you:

* View or edit the alert through the Atlas UI.

* Query the alert for the notification through the Atlas Administration API.

channelName.description: Name of the Slack channel to which MongoDB Cloud sends alert notifications. The resource requires this parameter when `"notifications.[n].typeName" : "SLACK"`.

delayMin.description: Number of minutes that MongoDB Cloud waits after detecting an alert condition before it sends out the first notification.

intervalMin.description:
Number of minutes to wait between successive notifications. MongoDB Cloud sends notifications until someone acknowledges the unacknowledged alert.

PagerDuty, VictorOps, and OpsGenie notifications don't return this element. Configure and manage the notification interval within each of those services.

notifierId.description: The notifierId is a system-generated unique identifier assigned to each notification method. This is needed when updating third-party notifications without requiring explicit authentication credentials.

typeName.description: Human-readable label that displays the alert notification type.

This option uses the following format: `"storageEngine" : { "<storage-engine-name>" : "<options>" }` MongoDB validates storage engine configuration options when creating indexes. To support replica sets with members with different storage engines, MongoDB logs these options to the oplog during replication. This option applies to all index types.

emailAddress.description:
Email address to which MongoDB Cloud sends alert notifications. The resource requires this parameter when `"notifications.[n].typeName" : "EMAIL"`. You don't need to set this value to send emails to individual or groups of MongoDB Cloud users including:

- specific MongoDB Cloud users (`"notifications.[n].typeName" : "USER"`)
- MongoDB Cloud users with specific project roles (`"notifications.[n].typeName" : "GROUP"`)
- MongoDB Cloud users with specific organization roles (`"notifications.[n].typeName" : "ORG"`)
- MongoDB Cloud teams (`"notifications.[n].typeName" : "TEAM"`)

To send emails to one MongoDB Cloud user or grouping of users, set the **notifications.[n].emailEnabled** parameter.

intervalMin.description:
Number of minutes to wait between successive notifications. MongoDB Cloud sends notifications until someone acknowledges the unacknowledged alert.

PagerDuty, VictorOps, and OpsGenie notifications don't return this element. Configure and manage the notification interval within each of those services.

notifierId.description: The notifierId is a system-generated unique identifier assigned to each notification method. This is needed when updating third-party notifications without requiring explicit authentication credentials.

typeName.description: Human-readable label that displays the alert notification type.

acknowledgedUntil.description: Date and time until which this alert has been acknowledged. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC. The resource returns this parameter if a MongoDB User previously acknowledged this alert. - To acknowledge this alert forever, set the parameter value to 100 years in the future. - To unacknowledge a previously acknowledged alert, set the parameter value to a date in the past.

acknowledgementComment.description: Comment that a MongoDB Cloud user submitted when acknowledging the alert.

acknowledgingUsername.description: MongoDB Cloud username of the person who acknowledged the alert. The response returns this parameter if a MongoDB Cloud user previously acknowledged this alert.

lastUsed.description: Date and time when MongoDB Cloud received the most recent request that originated from this Internet Protocol version 4 or version 6 address. The resource returns this parameter when at least one request has originated from this IP address. MongoDB Cloud updates this parameter each time a client accesses the permitted resource. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC.

lastUsedAddress.description: Network address that issued the most recent request to the API. This parameter requires the address to be expressed as one Internet Protocol version 4 or version 6 address. The resource returns this parameter after this IP address made at least one request.

ldapQuery.description: Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) query template that inserts the LDAP name that the regular expression matches into an LDAP query Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). VictorOps.description: Details to integrate one Splunk On-Call account with one MongoDB Cloud project.

apiKey.description:
Key that allows MongoDB Cloud to access your VictorOps account.

**NOTE**: After you create a notification which requires an API or integration key, the key appears partially redacted when you:

* View or edit the alert through the Atlas UI.

* Query the alert for the notification through the Atlas Administration API.

routingKey.description: Routing key associated with your Splunk On-Call account.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies the service to which you want to integrate with MongoDB Cloud. The value must match the third-party service integration type.

PagerDuty, VictorOps, and OpsGenie notifications don't return this element. Configure and manage the notification interval within each of those services.

victorOpsApiKey.description:
API key that MongoDB Cloud needs to send alert notifications to Splunk On-Call. The resource requires this parameter when `"notifications.[n].typeName" : "VICTOR_OPS"`. If the key later becomes invalid, MongoDB Cloud sends an email to the project owners. If the key remains invalid, MongoDB Cloud removes it.

**NOTE**: After you create a notification which requires an API or integration key, the key appears partially redacted when you:

* View or edit the alert through the Atlas UI.

* Query the alert for the notification through the Atlas Administration API.

The resource requires this parameter when `"notifications.[n].typeName" : "VICTOR_OPS"`. If the key later becomes invalid, MongoDB Cloud sends an email to the project owners. If the key remains invalid, MongoDB Cloud removes it.

Atlas returns this value if you set `"notifications.[n].typeName" :"WEBHOOK"` and either:
* You set `notification.[n].webhookSecret` to a non-empty string
* You set a default webhookSecret either on the [Integrations](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/third-party-service-integrations/#std-label-third-party-integrations) page, or with the [Integrations API](#tag/Third-Party-Service-Integrations/operation/createIntegration)

webhookUrl.description:
Target URL for a webhook-based alert.

Atlas returns this value if you set `"notifications.[n].typeName" :"WEBHOOK"` and either:
* You set `notification.[n].webhookURL` to a non-empty string
* You set a default webhookUrl either on the [Integrations](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/tutorial/third-party-service-integrations/#std-label-third-party-integrations) page, or with the [Integrations API](#tag/Third-Party-Service-Integrations/operation/createIntegration)

**NOTE**: When you view or edit the alert for a Webhook URL notification, the URL appears partially redacted.

WebhookNotification.title: Webhook Notification

dayOfWeek.description: Day of the week when the scheduled archive starts. The week starts with Monday (`1`) and ends with Sunday (`7`).

endHour.description: Hour of the day when the scheduled window to run one online archive ends.

endMinute.description: Minute of the hour when the scheduled window to run one online archive ends.

startHour.description: Hour of the day when the when the scheduled window to run one online archive starts.

startMinute.description: Minute of the hour when the scheduled window to run one online archive starts.

additionalProperties.description: Relative importance to place upon provided index parameters. This object expresses this as key/value pairs of index parameter and weight to apply to that parameter. You can specify weights for some or all the indexed parameters. The weight must be an integer between 1 and 99,999. MongoDB 5.0 and later can apply **weights** to **text** indexes only.

Weights.description: Relative importance to place upon provided index parameters. This object expresses this as key/value pairs of index parameter and weight to apply to that parameter. You can specify weights for some or all the indexed parameters. The weight must be an integer between 1 and 99,999. MongoDB 5.0 and later can apply **weights** to **text** indexes only.

ZoneMapping.description: Human-readable label that identifies the subset of a global cluster.

location.description: Code that represents a location that maps to a zone in your global cluster. MongoDB Cloud represents this location with a ISO 3166-2 location and subdivision codes when possible.

zone.description: Human-readable label that identifies the zone in your global cluster. This zone maps to a location code.

ZoneMapping.title: Global Cluster Zone

charFilterhtmlStrip.description: Filter that strips out HTML constructs.

ignoredTags.description: The HTML tags that you want to exclude from filtering.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this character filter type.

charFilterhtmlStrip.title: htmlStrip

charFiltericuNormalize.description: Filter that processes normalized text with the ICU Normalizer. It is based on Lucene's ICUNormalizer2CharFilter.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this character filter type.

charFiltericuNormalize.title: icuNormalize

charFiltermapping.description: Filter that applies normalization mappings that you specify to characters.

mappings.description:
Comma-separated list of mappings. A mapping indicates that one character or group of characters should be substituted for another, using the following format:

`<original> : <replacement>`

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this character filter type.

charFiltermapping.title: mapping

charFilterpersian.description: Filter that replaces instances of a zero-width non-joiner with an ordinary space. It is based on Lucene's PersianCharFilter.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this character filter type.

charFilterpersian.title: persian

raw.description: Additional meta information captured about this event. The response returns this parameter as a JSON object when the query parameter `includeRaw=true`. The list of fields in the raw document may change. Don't rely on raw values for formal monitoring.

alertConfigId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the alert configuration related to the event.

cid.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the project in which the event occurred.

cre.description: Date and time when this event occurred. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC.

gn.description: Human-readable label that identifies the project.

id.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the event.

orgId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the organization to which these events apply.

orgName.description: Human-readable label that identifies the organization that contains the project.

tokenFilterasciiFolding.description: Filter that converts alphabetic, numeric, and symbolic unicode characters that are not in the Basic Latin Unicode block to their ASCII equivalents, if available.

originalTokens.description:
Value that indicates whether to include or omit the original tokens in the output of the token filter.

Choose `include` if you want to support queries on both the original tokens as well as the converted forms.

 Choose `omit` if you want to query only on the converted forms of the original tokens.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this token filter type.

tokenFilterasciiFolding.title: asciiFolding

tokenFilterdaitchMokotoffSoundex.description:
Filter that creates tokens for words that sound the same based on the Daitch-Mokotoff Soundex phonetic algorithm. This filter can generate multiple encodings for each input, where each encoded token is a 6 digit number.

**NOTE**: Don't use the **daitchMokotoffSoundex** token filter in:

-Synonym or autocomplete mapping definitions
- Operators where **fuzzy** is enabled. Atlas Search supports the **fuzzy** option only for the **autocomplete**, **term**, and **text** operators.

originalTokens.description:
Value that indicates whether to include or omit the original tokens in the output of the token filter.

Choose `include` if you want to support queries on both the original tokens as well as the converted forms.

 Choose `omit` if you want to query only on the converted forms of the original tokens.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this token filter type.

tokenFilterdaitchMokotoffSoundex.title: daitchMokotoffSoundex

tokenFilteredgeGram.description: Filter that tokenizes input from the left side, or "edge", of a text input into n-grams of configured sizes. You can't use this token filter in synonym or autocomplete mapping definitions.

maxGram.description: Value that specifies the maximum length of generated n-grams. This value must be greater than or equal to **minGram**.

minGram.description: Value that specifies the minimum length of generated n-grams. This value must be less than or equal to **maxGram**.

termNotInBounds.description: Value that indicates whether to index tokens shorter than **minGram** or longer than **maxGram**.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this token filter type.

tokenFilteredgeGram.title: edgeGram

tokenFiltericuFolding.description: Filter that applies character folding from Unicode Technical Report #30.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this token filter type.

tokenFiltericuFolding.title: icuFolding

tokenFiltericuNormalizer.description: Filter that normalizes tokens using a standard Unicode Normalization Mode.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this token filter type.

tokenFiltericuNormalizer.title: icuNormalizer

tokenFilterlength.description: Filter that removes tokens that are too short or too long.

max.description: Number that specifies the maximum length of a token. Value must be greater than or equal to **min**.

min.description: Number that specifies the minimum length of a token. This value must be less than or equal to **max**.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this token filter type.

tokenFilterlength.title: length

tokenFilterlowercase.description: Filter that normalizes token text to lowercase.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this token filter type.

tokenFilterlowercase.title: lowercase

tokenFilternGram.description: Filter that tokenizes input into n-grams of configured sizes. You can't use this token filter in synonym or autocomplete mapping definitions.

maxGram.description: Value that specifies the maximum length of generated n-grams. This value must be greater than or equal to **minGram**.

minGram.description: Value that specifies the minimum length of generated n-grams. This value must be less than or equal to **maxGram**.

termNotInBounds.description: Value that indicates whether to index tokens shorter than **minGram** or longer than **maxGram**.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this token filter type.

tokenFilternGram.title: nGram

tokenFilterregex.description: Filter that applies a regular expression to each token, replacing matches with a specified string.

matches.description: Value that indicates whether to replace only the first matching pattern or all matching patterns.

pattern.description: Regular expression pattern to apply to each token.

replacement.description: Replacement string to substitute wherever a matching pattern occurs.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this token filter type.

tokenFilterregex.title: regex

tokenFilterreverse.description: Filter that reverses each string token.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this token filter type.

tokenFilterreverse.title: reverse

tokenFiltershingle.description: Filter that constructs shingles (token n-grams) from a series of tokens. You can't use this token filter in synonym or autocomplete mapping definitions.

maxShingleSize.description: Value that specifies the maximum number of tokens per shingle. This value must be greater than or equal to **minShingleSize**.

minShingleSize.description: Value that specifies the minimum number of tokens per shingle. This value must be less than or equal to **maxShingleSize**.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this token filter type.

tokenFiltershingle.title: shingle

tokenFiltersnowballStemming.description: Filter that stems tokens using a Snowball-generated stemmer.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this token filter type.

tokenFiltersnowballStemming.title: snowballStemming

tokenFilterstopword.description: Filter that removes tokens that correspond to the specified stop words. This token filter doesn't analyze the stop words that you specify.

ignoreCase.description: Flag that indicates whether to ignore the case of stop words when filtering the tokens to remove.

tokens.description: The stop words that correspond to the tokens to remove. Value must be one or more stop words.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this token filter type.

tokenFilterstopword.title: stopword

tokenFiltertrim.description: Filter that trims leading and trailing whitespace from tokens.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this token filter type.

tokenFiltertrim.title: trim

tokenizeredgeGram.description: Tokenizer that splits input from the left side, or "edge", of a text input into n-grams of given sizes. You can't use the edgeGram tokenizer in synonym or autocomplete mapping definitions.

maxGram.description: Characters to include in the longest token that Atlas Search creates.

minGram.description: Characters to include in the shortest token that Atlas Search creates.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this tokenizer type.

tokenizeredgeGram.title: edgeGram

tokenizerkeyword.description: Tokenizer that combines the entire input as a single token.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this tokenizer type.

tokenizerkeyword.title: keyword

tokenizernGram.description: Tokenizer that splits input into text chunks, or "n-grams", of into given sizes. You can't use the nGram tokenizer in synonym or autocomplete mapping definitions.

maxGram.description: Characters to include in the longest token that Atlas Search creates.

minGram.description: Characters to include in the shortest token that Atlas Search creates.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this tokenizer type.

tokenizernGram.title: nGram

tokenizerregexCaptureGroup.description: Tokenizer that uses a regular expression pattern to extract tokens.

group.description: Index of the character group within the matching expression to extract into tokens. Use `0` to extract all character groups.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this tokenizer type.

tokenizerregexCaptureGroup.title: regexCaptureGroup

tokenizerregexSplit.description: Tokenizer that splits tokens using a regular-expression based delimiter.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this tokenizer type.

tokenizerregexSplit.title: regexSplit

tokenizerstandard.description: Tokenizer that splits tokens based on word break rules from the Unicode Text Segmentation algorithm.

maxTokenLength.description: Maximum number of characters in a single token. Tokens greater than this length are split at this length into multiple tokens.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this tokenizer type.

tokenizerstandard.title: standard

tokenizeruaxUrlEmail.description: Tokenizer that creates tokens from URLs and email addresses. Although this tokenizer uses word break rules from the Unicode Text Segmentation algorithm, we recommend using it only when the indexed field value includes URLs and email addresses. For fields that don't include URLs or email addresses, use the **standard** tokenizer to create tokens based on word break rules.

maxTokenLength.description: Maximum number of characters in a single token. Tokens greater than this length are split at this length into multiple tokens.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this tokenizer type.

tokenizeruaxUrlEmail.title: uaxUrlEmail

tokenizerwhitespace.description: Tokenizer that creates tokens based on occurrences of whitespace between words.

maxTokenLength.description: Maximum number of characters in a single token. Tokens greater than this length are split at this length into multiple tokens.

type.description: Human-readable label that identifies this tokenizer type.

tokenizerwhitespace.title: whitespace
